definitions: young woman of noble birth, especially in medieval stories and literature
examples: The knight rescued the damsel from the dragon's tower
Medieval tales often featured damsels in distress awaiting rescue

definitions: series of movements performed to music with rhythm and pattern
social gathering where people move rhythmically to music for entertainment
specific choreographed sequence of steps with a particular name or style
examples: Her dance captivated the entire audience with graceful movements
The traditional dance requires years of training to master
The school dance attracted hundreds of students last Saturday
They met at a dance hosted by the community center
The tango dance originated in Argentina and Uruguay
Learning the wedding dance took them several rehearsal sessions

definitions: person who performs dances professionally or as a form of artistic expression
examples: The ballet dancer practiced for hours every single day
Professional dancers require exceptional physical fitness and artistic talent

definitions: the activity of moving rhythmically to music, typically following set patterns
examples: Dancing helps improve cardiovascular health and coordination skills
She has been dancing since she was five years old

definitions: common yellow-flowered plant with deeply notched leaves, often considered a weed
examples: Children love blowing dandelion seeds into the wind
The lawn was covered with bright yellow dandelions

definitions: man excessively concerned with fashion and appearance in dress and manner
something that is particularly fine, excellent, or first-rate in quality
examples: The Victorian dandy spent hours perfecting his appearance daily
Oscar Wilde was known as a famous dandy of his era
That new car of yours is a real dandy
The solution worked out just dandy for everyone involved

definitions: possibility of suffering harm, injury, loss, or other negative consequences
examples: The hikers were unaware of the danger lurking ahead
Warning signs alert people to potential danger in construction zones

definitions: the state or action of hanging or swinging loosely from something
examples: The dangling of keys from his belt made noise
Her dangling earrings caught everyone's attention at the party

definitions: sweet pastry made of yeast dough with butter, often containing fruit or custard
examples: She ordered a cheese danish with her morning coffee
The bakery sells fresh danish pastries every morning

definitions: challenge to do something requiring courage, especially something dangerous or frightening
examples: He accepted the dare to jump into the cold lake
Children often issue dares to test each other's bravery

definitions: person who enjoys doing dangerous things and taking unnecessary risks for excitement
examples: The daredevil performed stunts without any safety equipment
Professional daredevils train extensively before attempting dangerous feats

definitions: willingness to take risks and act with adventurous courage despite danger
examples: Her daring in confronting injustice inspired many others
The rescue required exceptional daring and precise timing

definitions: absence or deficiency of light making visibility difficult or impossible
period after sunset when natural light is absent from the sky
examples: The power outage left them sitting in complete dark
She always carried a flashlight to navigate the dark
Children should be home before dark for safety reasons
The park closes at dark during winter months

definitions: process of becoming darker or reducing the amount of light present
examples: The darkening of the sky signaled an approaching storm
Window tinting provides darkening for better sleep quality

definitions: room with no light or with special red lighting for developing photographs
examples: The photographer spent hours in the darkroom developing prints
Digital photography has reduced the need for traditional darkrooms

definitions: person who is dearly loved, used as term of endearment
person or thing that is particularly popular, successful, or favored
examples: She called her granddaughter her little darling every visit
His darling wife supported him through difficult times
The actress became the darling of Broadway after her performance
This restaurant is the darling of food critics citywide

definitions: place in fabric that has been repaired by weaving thread across a hole
examples: The darn in his sock was barely visible after repair
Her sweater had several darns from years of use

definitions: small pointed missile thrown or shot as weapon or in games
sudden quick movement in a particular direction
tapered seam sewn into fabric to shape a garment
examples: He threw the dart directly into the bullseye
The bar has several dart boards for customer entertainment
The rabbit made a dart across the open field
Her dart to the door surprised everyone in attendance
The tailor added darts to improve the dress fit
Darts in clothing help create a more flattering silhouette

definitions: sudden quick run or rush to reach something
small quantity of liquid or substance added to something
horizontal stroke in writing used as punctuation mark
spirited style, vigor, or liveliness in manner or appearance
examples: She made a dash for the train before doors closed
His dash to the finish line won him the race
Add just a dash of salt to enhance the flavor
A dash of cream improves the coffee considerably
Use a dash to separate clauses in your sentence
The dash indicates a pause longer than a comma
He completed the project with considerable dash and flair
Her outfit had a certain dash that caught attention

definitions: panel with instruments and controls in front of vehicle driver
visual display of important information and metrics in software interface
examples: The car's dashboard displays speed and fuel levels
Warning lights on the dashboard indicate mechanical problems
The analytics dashboard shows real-time website traffic data
Managers use the dashboard to monitor key performance indicators

definitions: structured collection of data stored and accessed electronically from computer system
examples: The company database contains millions of customer records
Database management requires regular backup and maintenance procedures

definitions: particular day shown by number on calendar or specified time
social or romantic appointment between two people
sweet dark brown oval fruit from date palm tree
examples: The date for the wedding is June fifteenth
Please confirm the date of your next appointment
Their first date was dinner at an Italian restaurant
He asked her on a date after weeks of conversation
Dates are naturally sweet and highly nutritious dried fruits
She added chopped dates to the energy bar recipe

definitions: line at beginning of news article showing place and date of writing
examples: The dateline showed the report came from London yesterday
Journalists must include accurate datelines in their dispatches

definitions: practice of going on dates to develop romantic relationships
process of determining age or period of historical objects
examples: Online dating has become increasingly popular among young adults
Dating can be stressful but also exciting and rewarding
Carbon dating helps archaeologists determine artifact ages precisely
The dating of fossils relies on various scientific methods

definitions: single piece of information or fact used as basis for reasoning or calculation
examples: Each datum was carefully verified before including in analysis
This datum contradicts our initial hypothesis about the phenomenon

definitions: patch or smear of thick or sticky substance applied roughly
examples: A daub of paint covered the scratch on the wall
The child left daubs of mud throughout the clean hallway

definitions: female offspring in relation to either or both of her parents
examples: Their daughter graduated from medical school with honors
She has three daughters and two sons in total

definitions: first appearance of light in sky before sunrise each morning
beginning or first appearance of something new and important
examples: Birds start singing at dawn every spring morning
The fishermen set out at dawn for the best catch
The dawn of civilization brought agriculture and permanent settlements
We're witnessing the dawn of artificial intelligence revolution

definitions: gradual beginning or first appearance of understanding, feeling, or development
examples: The dawning of realization showed clearly on her face
We're experiencing the dawning of a technological revolution

definitions: period of twenty-four hours as unit of time
time between sunrise and sunset when there is daylight
particular period of past or present time with distinctive features
examples: The package will arrive within three business days
There are three hundred sixty-five days in a year
She works during the day and studies at night
The days are longer in summer than in winter
In my day, we didn't have smartphones or internet
The day of handwritten letters has largely passed

definitions: time in morning when daylight first appears in the sky
examples: The rooster crows every morning at daybreak without fail
They planned to depart at daybreak to avoid traffic

definitions: facility providing supervision and care for children during working hours
examples: The daycare center opens at seven o'clock each morning
Finding affordable daycare remains challenging for working parents

definitions: pleasant series of thoughts that distract from present surroundings and activities
examples: Her daydream about vacation was interrupted by the bell
He often had daydreams about becoming a famous musician

definitions: activity of indulging in pleasant fantasies while awake, often distracting from reality
examples: Excessive daydreaming can interfere with productivity at work
Daydreaming during class caused him to miss important information

definitions: natural light from sun during daytime hours between dawn and dusk
examples: The room looks much better in natural daylight conditions
Daylight savings time affects our sleep schedules annually

definitions: period of day when there is natural light from the sun
examples: Most businesses operate during regular daytime hours only
Daytime television features different programming than prime time

definitions: state of stunned confusion or bewilderment, often from shock or blow
examples: She walked around in a daze after hearing the news
The accident left him in a daze for several minutes

definitions: brilliant or impressive display that amazes or temporarily overwhelms the senses
examples: The dazzle of city lights amazed the rural visitors
Her performance was pure dazzle from beginning to end

definitions: ordained minister ranking below priest in Christian churches with administrative duties
examples: The deacon assisted with communion service every Sunday morning
She was appointed as the first female deacon last year

definitions: process of making something inactive or non-functional, especially technical systems
examples: Account deactivation requires administrative approval and verification steps
The bomb squad handled the device deactivation with extreme care

definitions: collective term for people who have died or are no longer living
examples: Prayers were offered for the dead at the memorial
The dead shall be remembered on this solemn day

definitions: weight training exercise lifting loaded barbell from ground to hip level
examples: The deadlift targets multiple muscle groups simultaneously and effectively
Proper deadlift form prevents back injuries during heavy lifting

definitions: latest time or date by which something must be completed or submitted
examples: The project deadline is next Friday at noon sharp
Missing the deadline could result in contract cancellation

definitions: situation where progress is impossible due to disagreement or opposing forces
examples: The negotiations reached a deadlock over salary demands
Congressional deadlock prevented the bill from passing this session

definitions: dead branches or trees that are no longer productive
people or things that are no longer useful or productive in organization
examples: Clearing deadwood helps the forest regenerate more effectively
The pile of deadwood needs removal before fire season
Management decided to eliminate deadwood from the company structure
Getting rid of deadwood improved overall team productivity significantly

definitions: people who have partial or complete inability to hear sounds
examples: The school for the deaf uses sign language instruction
Services for the deaf include interpreters and closed captions

definitions: agreement or arrangement, especially in business, on particular terms
distribution of playing cards to players in a card game
large but indefinite quantity or extent of something
examples: They struck a deal to merge their companies next year
The deal includes warranty and free maintenance services
It's your turn to do the next deal
A bad deal can ruin your chances in poker
He knows a great deal about classical music history
We spent a good deal of time discussing options

definitions: person or business buying and selling goods, especially vehicles or drugs
person who distributes cards in a card game
examples: The car dealer offered competitive financing options for buyers
Art dealers attend auctions to find valuable pieces
The dealer shuffled cards before starting the next round
In blackjack, players compete against the dealer directly

definitions: business authorized to sell particular company's products, especially vehicles
examples: The automotive dealership offers both new and used vehicles
She manages three dealerships across the metropolitan area

definitions: business relations or transactions, especially buying and selling
way of behaving toward or managing situations with others
examples: His dealing in antiques made him wealthy over time
Honest dealing builds trust between business partners effectively
Her dealing with difficult customers showed remarkable patience
Fair dealing earned him respect throughout the community
